concept.title: Setting up Couchbase Server
concept.shortdesc: When you open the web console for the first time, you need to set up Couchbase Server. When trying out Couchbase Server, you can accept the default values for many of the options.

ol.li:
Open a browser and navigate to http://hostname:8091/.
In the URL, hostname represents the name or IP address of the computer that hosts Couchbase Server. If Couchbase Server is running locally, you can use localhost for the host name.
On the Configure Server screen, under Start a new cluster, select the check boxes for data, query, and index services and then click Next.

li.p: On the Sample Buckets screen, select the beer-sample and travel-sample buckets, and then click Next.

ol.li: On the Create Default Bucket screen, click Next to accept the default values.
On the Notifications screen, enter your registration information, agree to the terms and conditions, and click Next.
On the Configure Server screen, enter a password for the Administrator user name, and then click Next.
